⊹₊ ˚‧︵‿₊୨ ᰔ ୧₊‿︵‧ ˚ ₊⊹

This crispy seafood pancake ('Haemul Pajeon' in Korean) is a popular savory pancake in South Korea and it's made of a simple batter featuring seafood and green onions.

![Korean Seafood Pancake (Haemul Pajeon)](https://christieathome.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/Korean-Seafood-Pancake19-768x1020.jpg){fig-align="center"}

⊹₊ ˚‧︵‿₊୨ ᰔ ୧₊‿︵‧ ˚ ₊⊹

## Ingredients
Makes ~5 pancakes

### Pancakes
-   [ ] ~1/2 cup seafood, chopped
-   [ ] 2 green onions, chopped
-   [ ] 1 tbsp carrot, chopped
-   [ ] 1/4 cup flour
-   [ ] 1/4 cup potato starch
-   [ ] 1/2 tbsp baking powder
-   [ ] 1/4 cup *cold* water
-   [ ] 1/2 tbsp fish sauce
-   [ ] 1/2 tbsp chicken boullion powder
-   [ ] 1/2 tbsp garlic powder
-   [ ] 1/2 tbsp onion powder
-   [ ] salt and pepper to taste
-   [ ] 1 tbsp sesame oil
-   [ ] vegetable oil, as needed

### Dipping sauce
-   [ ] 2 tbsp soy sauce
-   [ ] 2 tbsp rice vinegar
-   [ ] 1/2 tbsp sesame oil
-   [ ] 1/2 green onion, chopped

## Steps

1. Pat dry seafood and vegetables. Prepare and chop to size (I prefer 2in matchsticks) 

2. In a large bowl, whisk together dry ingredients, Then add vegetables and seafood with **cold** water and mix until combined.

2. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add enough vegetable oil to coat evenly

3. Pour mixture into an even thin (~1/2 in) layer on the skillet.

4. After about 5 minutes, the bottom of the pancakes will become crunchy -- gently flip over

5. Cook another 5 minutes and flip. Repeat until both sides are a light golden brown. Transfer to ctting board Keep making pancakes until the batter is used up!

::: {.callout-note title="Tip"}
Clean the skillet with paper towels between batches
:::

6. Slice pancakes into wedges and transfer to large serving plate.

7. In a small bowl, combine depping sauce ingredients and serve with pancake.
